trans-unit.source: Use the `AssignCulture` element in your project file to create and execute this task.
For usage and parameter information, see [AssignCulture Task](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture"></xref> class.
Gets a list of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.Files*> with a `Culture` metadata entry added to each item.
If the incoming item from the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.Files%2A> property already contains a `Culture` metadata entry, the original metadata entry is used.
The task only assigns a `Culture` metadata entry if the file name contains a valid culture identifier.
The culture identifier must be between the last two dots in the filename.
The list of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.Files*>, with a `Culture` metadata entry added to each item.
Gets a subset of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.AssignedFiles*> that have a `Culture` metadata entry.
A subset of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.AssignedFiles*> that have a `Culture` metadata entry.
Gets a subset of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.AssignedFiles*> that do not have a `Culture` metadata entry.
A subset of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.AssignedFiles*> that do not have a `Culture` metadata entry.
Gets a subset of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.AssignedFiles*> that do not have a `Culture` metadata entry.
A subset of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.AssignCulture.AssignedFiles*> that do not have a `Culture` metadata entry.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if task execution succeeded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a list of files with embedded culture names to assign a culture to.
The list of files with embedded culture names to assign a culture to.
